item.title: Gain Energy
item.detail:
Oatmeal

Provides staying power so you wont crash between the 10th and 11th laps.

Raisins

Grab a handful during long workouts for a natural energy boost.

Bananas

Just as effective as sports drink at keeping your electrolyte balanced.

item.title: Soothe Pain
item.detail:
Ginger

Fights nausea and can reduce muscle pain by about 20 percent.

Tart Cherries

They neutralize free radicals so you can recover faster.

Turmeric

The spice that makes curry yellow acts like ibuprofen against joint pain.

item.title: Build Muscle
item.description: Eggs, Whey Protien, Salmon or Tuna
item.detail:
Eggs

This rich source of amino acid leucine jump-starts muscle repair.

Whey Protein

Prime building material for tight abs and toned glutes.

Salmon or Tuna

Their protien urges your muscle to begin the strengthening process.

item.title: Spike Metabolism
item.detail:
Pistachios

Curb post workout hunger without packing on the pounds.

Beets

These bad boys help you push harder with less effort during your workouts.

Edamame

Soybeans are high in fat-torching protein and fibre.
